channel.title: 317 Client | Mac | Please Help ASAP
channel.description:
Hey MoparScape! I am the BIGGEST Mac noob. I just got my 317 Allstar server to run, but now I am having problems running the client. In terminal I type "java -Xmx800M EGUI" I get this: [code]Last login: Fri Jan 31 18:22:40 on ttyp1 Welcome to Darwin! Codys-Macbook-Pro:~ User$ cd /Users/User/Desktop/Client/ Codys-Macbook-Pro:~/Desktop/Client User$ java -Xmx800M EGUI java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319) Exception in thread "main" Codys-Macbook-Pro:~/Desktop/Client User$
[/code]
Please help?

item.title: 317 Client | Mac | Please Help ASAP
item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:10, topic:539489”][quote author=FizzerX637 link=topic=658328.msg4404135#msg4404135 date=1391377394]

Update your java.

and if I cant?

What do you mean you can’t.

I am on an older mac, running Tiger 10.4.11.
I have the newest Java update I can get with this OS X.

I’m pretty sure the error you are getting is that someone compiled that file with a higher java than you. You have to delete the class file and then you can compile again.

It says it for any client I try to run. :\

What’s your jdk version. Maybe I’m wrong.

Not sure how to figure that out. I am a Mac noob.
[/quote]
This has nothing to do with your mac. Just check what version of jdk you have currently.[/quote]

Not sure how I figure that out. If I were running PC I could easily tell you.

Read full topic

item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

Hey MoparScape! I am the BIGGEST Mac noob. I just got my 317 Allstar server to run, but now I am having problems running the client. In terminal I type “java -Xmx800M EGUI” I get this:

[code]Last login: Fri Jan 31 18:22:40 on ttyp1
Welcome to Darwin!
Codys-Macbook-Pro:~ User$ cd /Users/User/Desktop/Client/
Codys-Macbook-Pro:~/Desktop/Client User$ java -Xmx800M EGUI
java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319)
Exception in thread “main” Codys-Macbook-Pro:~/Desktop/Client User$

[/code]

Please help?
